p: The essential oils showed significant antimicrobial activity against all Gram-positive and Gram-negative microorganisms tested, giving inhibition zones ranging between 6 and 41.33 mm for the green cardamom essential oil, between 11.33 and 32.00 mm for the Ethiopian cardamom essential oil, and between 6 to 43 mm for the black cardamom essential oil. The high diameters of the growth inhibition zones were obtained when Gram-positive bacteria are tested for the three volatile oils.
